intro: Jacquemontia bracteosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other morning glories. It has a climbing habit, with tendrils that allow it to ascend supports. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
